algorithms.trees

Class Tree_Batch

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.trees.TDP_Anyk_Iterator
      • algorithms.trees.Tree_Batch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tree_BatchSorting

    public class Tree_Batch
extends TDP_Anyk_Iterator
    This algorithm produces all the solutions to a T-DP problem specified as a TDP_Problem_Instance object. The class has been customized for join problems only since it produces Tree_Query_Solution as results. It is implemented as an iterator that is first initialized and then the method get_next() returns the next solution (in no particular order). The method get_next() is implemented as DFS-style traversal on the state-space graph. This implementation is conceptually the same as the two passes of the Yannakakis algorithm https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.5555/1286831.1286840.

    IMPORTANT: Before using this class, the nodes and the edges of the T-DP state-space graph must have already been initialized either by TDP_Problem_Instance.bottom_up() or some other method.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis
